revisions.rev:
{{for|the anonymous electronic cash system|ecash}} {{Refimprove|date=March 2009}} {{update|date=December 2010}} {{lowercase}} '''eCache''' is an [[Anonymous Internet banking|anonymous bank]] operating through interfaces in the [[Tor (anonymity network)|Tor]] network. The bank issues cryptographic certificates, ''digital bearer certificates'', that can be exchanged among the bank's users. The certificates can be bought and sold for real money through the bank. The owners and operators of the bank are unknown, and the bank is said{{Who|date=March 2009}} to operate outside the laws of any country. The name eCache was suggested by Steven Schear to eCache's operators from a prior bearer digital money venture.<ref>http://www.wired.com/wired/archive/7.08/mustread_pr.html</ref>
== Currencies supported == * '''COW''' â A dummy currency that is used only for testing the system. The currency is copied from the predecessor Yodelbank. * '''GG''' â A currency that is backed by gold. One GG is worth one gram of gold.
== Operators accepting GG == * '''Metropipe''' â An [[Internet service provider]] that has specialized in anonymity.<ref>http://metropipe.net</ref>
== See also == * [[Anonymous internet banking]] * [[Crypto-anarchism]] * [[Bitcoin]] * [[itex Corporation]]
